comment.author: 76613462@N00
comment._content: This is absolutely fantastic. I didn't know something like this existed. Who is the photographer?

comment.author: 12477606@N03
comment._content:
Correct spelling:
Troms² = Tromsø (the name of the town)
Tromstind = Tromsdalstind
Troms² = Troms (the name of the county)

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks! Good to have the right county name, and glad you were able to decipher the ø hidden under the 2. All fixed now.

comment.author: 12477606@N03
comment._content:
The Sami name for Tromsdalstind is Sálašoaivi.
Tromsø Cathedral (to the right) was built in 1861.
This view today: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/larslars/2538590346/]

comment.author: 29871380@N00
comment._content:
Hi, it is really interesting to see the development from then to now. Very cool!

This LOC on Flickr thing is really great!!

comment.author: 7345382@N06
comment._content: Great shot of my birthplace! Thanks for sharing this jewel!

comment.author: 48062848@N03
comment._content: So fun to see Tromsø, where I live, as it looked 100 years ago. The mountains, Fløya and Tromsdalstinden, have not changed a bit, but the city is totaly different. A fascinating picture.
